div1.p: No 12
Consulate General of the United States. Monrovia, Liberia, May 1st 1888.
Mr B. Y. Payne to the Hon., Secretary of State
Subject
Receipt of Despatch No 18 Dipo' Series, and compensation

Sir I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your No 18 Diplomatic Series of the 22nd utl., with enclosure of form of Account and Draft, informing that Mr. Charles H. J. Taylor has resigned the position of United States Minister to Liberia, and his agreement
Hon., T. F. Bayard Secretary of State
agreement

agreement with me, as to my compensation during his leave of absence has expired: also ~ informing you that the Department desires me to remain in charge of the archives of the Legation and Consulate General, pending the arrival of a successer to Mr Taylor, stating further that I shall receive the same compensation for service of $300 per annum, the account allowed me by Mr Taylor.
I thank you, for the confidence reposed in me, in wishing me to remain in charge of the Legation.
For your better information, I enclose Mr. Taylor's two letters to me, in which he offered me me

me the position with compensation at the rate of $300 per annum. You are aware I contracted with Mr. Taylor for this amount, but you will see by his letter and the contract that I was already employed, and would have nothing to do, but attend the mails, and keep in safety the Archives of the Legation: SInce, a Bond of $3000 has bee required of me, which I have forwarded to the Department.

I consented to receive the compensation offered by Mr. Taylor because he would be absent but twelve (12) ~ vessels, as I had occasion to refer you to some time ago: now that Mr. Taylor's functions has ceased, and I required to give give

give the Bond required of a Vice Consul General. I cannot for the compensation offend, hence, I do not sign the Draft for services to 31st March, at Mr Taylor's rate of compensation, but retain it, and await your advice, as I am quite satisfied you can see my position. I have in many instance lost in my other avocation to do justice and hence to the trust I have.

I do not object to receiving compensation at the rate contracted with Mr. Taylor for the terms of his incumbency, therefore I have this day drawn my Draft No 1 on the Secretary of State for services according to the Contract Contract
Contract from October 3rd 1887 (The date of Mr Taylor's departure) to the 12th January 1888 when his official function, and my contract with him ceased.
I enclose account , as per copy for form, transmitted to me.

Having forwarded my Bond to the Department, and reported, I consider myself directly responsible to the Government of the United States, and to it will I expect compensation for service from January 12th 1888.
I have the honor to be Sir, Your obedient Servant
Beverly Y. Payne
Enclosures, Mr Taylor to Mr Payne Sec'y Barclay,, ,, Taylor Account Compensation
